title: ICE running druid examples (unwrap `JoinHandle::join`)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I suspect that something major has gone wrong with my OS (e.g. spawning threads isn't working), but since I got an ICE I thought I'd report it here. It might be worth handling thread spawn failure gracefully. ### Code Download [`druid`](https://github.com/linebender/druid) and run `cargo run --example svg2` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.49.0 (e1884a8e3 2020-12-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: e1884a8e3c3e813aada8254edfa120e85bf5ffca commit-date: 2020-12-29 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.49.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /rustc/e1884a8e3c3e813aada8254edfa120e85bf5ffca/library/std/src/thread/mod.rs:1245:48 ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/e1884a8e3c3e813aada8254edfa120e85bf5ffca/library/std/src/panicking.rs:495:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/e1884a8e3c3e813aada8254edfa120e85bf5ffca/library/core/src/panicking.rs:92:14 2: core::panicking::panic at /rustc/e1884a8e3c3e813aada8254edfa120e85bf5ffca/library/core/src/panicking.rs:50:5 3: std::thread::JoinHandle::join 4: rustc_interface::util::setup_callbacks_and_run_in_thread_pool_with_globals 5: rustc_driver::RunCompiler::run 6: as core::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once 7: rustc_driver::catch_with_exit_code 8: rustc_driver::main 9: rustc_main::main note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.49.0 (e1884a8e3 2020-12-29) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack ```
